title: Who is the best black African American male actor? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many fine ones. After seeing the latest “True Detective” I’m going with Mahershala Ali. It is actually hard to know since so many take crappy parts for the bucks (Samuel Jackson, I’m mean you) so you don’t get to see much finesse. Denzel Washington was better in his original TV show set in Boston than he is in movies nowadays (“Training Day” excepted). I though Blair Underwood was wonderful until he disappeared. Morgan Freeman was great in “Nurse Betty”. Jeffrey Wright is often wasted. Why don’t these guys do Shakespeare so we can see then let loose? Laurence Fishburne seems an exception. And the black Brits keep getting those juicy roles.

Black African-American, well, that’s specific, for there may be some African-Americans who are not black, not everyone from Africa is black. Anyway….don’t think there is one best. How ’bout Forest Whitaker, Andre Braugher, Ossie Davis, James Earl Jones, Don Cheadle, Ving Rhames, Michael B. Jordan, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Paul Winfield, Anthony Mackie, Morris Chestnut, Delroy Lindo, Morgan Freeman, Courtney B. Vance, and potentially the late Chadwick Boseman? There are so many other fine actors to add to this list, but you get my drift. (Thinking about this topic reminded me it’s been a long time since I’ve seen Robert Townsend’s “Hollywood Shuffle” with the famous “Black Acting School” sequence. )
